The results were worse this time. The repository version 0.12.2 has the issue intermittently, then diffs cause the issue to happen on any terminal command. I did the same during this testing and opened a text file with neovim during the log output.

If you pass `-o debug.renderer=gles2_pure` to `0.12.2` version is it changing anything?

It looks to me like an NVIDIA issue, you likely don't have this with the kitty due to how it renderers, as in it tries to redraw a lot on user driven input, but we redraw only **when needed** which clearly breaks with nvidia...

Maybe there're settings in the driver which you could tune to make it work, but I'm not sure how to help with nvidia.
Also, if you had a clear evidence that it worked before, could you try `v0.11.0` version?

rename.to: Window is getting stuck until a key press with NVIDIA drivers

> If you pass `-o debug.renderer=gles2_pure` to `0.12.2` version is it changing anything?

> It looks to me like an NVIDIA issue, you likely don't have this with the kitty due to how it renderers, as in it tries to redraw a lot on user driven input, but we redraw only **when needed** which clearly breaks with nvidia...
> 
> Maybe there're settings in the driver which you could tune to make it work, but I'm not sure how to help with nvidia.

Without more testing I cannot say if this made any improvements to the occurrence of the issue, but I can say for a fact it does not eliminate the issue.



> Also, if you had a clear evidence that it worked before, could you try `v0.11.0` version?
